1. Panasonic 2.2 cu. ft. 1250W Inverter Microwave NN-SN966SR – highest power, largest capacity, inverter & sensor cooking.  
2. LG LMC2075ST 2.0 cu. ft. NeoChef – large capacity, modern design, stable turntable, strong feature set.  
3. Sharp SMC1452CH 1.4 cu. ft. 1100W – good family size, high power, reputable Carousel design.  
4. Toshiba EM131A5C-BS 1.2 cu. ft. 900W – sensor cooking, many presets, good all‑rounder.  
5. Magic Chef 1.1 cu. ft. Countertop – mid-size, standard power/features, basic but functional.  
6. Breville Compact Wave Soft Close 0.9 cu. ft. 900W – smaller but high quality; strong on quiet/ergonomics more than raw performance.  
7. Haier 0.9 cu. ft. 900W HMC920BEWW – decent specs but discontinued, Wi‑Fi is a plus yet longevity/support is weaker.  
8. Galanz Retro 0.7 cu. ft. 700W – lowest power and capacity; mainly for style/compact spaces, not performance.

1. Panasonic NN-SN966SR – 2.2 cu. ft., 1250 W, inverter, large capacity, strong feature set.  
2. LG LMC2075ST – 2.0 cu. ft., sensor cooking, modern features, good capacity.  
3. SHARP SMC1452CH – 1.4 cu. ft., 1100 W, sensor and preset functions, solid mid‑size.  
4. Toshiba EM131A5C-BS – 1.2 cu. ft., up to 1100 W, sensor reheat, many presets.  
5. GE/Haier 1.1 cu. ft. Countertop – mid‑size, decent power and features.  
6. Haier HMC920BEWW 0.9 cu. ft. – compact, basic but adequate power.  
7. Breville Compact Wave Soft Close – 0.9 cu. ft., 900 W, strong convenience/quiet‑door focus but smaller.  
8. Galanz GLCMKA07BKR-07 Retro – 0.7 cu. ft., lower power, style-focused, least versatile.
